us.ihmc.euclid.geometry

Class Ramp3D

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.ihmc.euclid.geometry.Shape3D<Ramp3D>
      • us.ihmc.euclid.geometry.Ramp3D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Clearable, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.EpsilonComparable<Ramp3D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometricallyComparable<Ramp3D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometryObject<Ramp3D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Settable<Ramp3D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Transformable

    public class Ramp3D
extends Shape3D<Ramp3D>
    Ramp3D represents a 3D shape with a triangular section in the XZ-plane.

    Shape description:

    • The slope face starts from x=0.0, z=0.0 to end at x=size.getX(), z=size.getZ().
    • The bottom face is horizontal (XY-plane) at z=0.0.
    • The rear face is vertical (YZ-plane) at x=size.getX().
    • The left face is vertical (XZ-plane) at y=-size.getY()/2.0.
    • The right face is vertical (XZ-plane) at y=size.getY()/2.0.

      • getRampLength

        public double getRampLength()
        Gets the length of this ramp's slope part.

        Note that this is different than getLength(). The returned value is equal to: √(this.length2 + this.height2)

        Returns:
        the length of the slope.

      • getRampSurfaceNormal

        Parameters:

      • getRampIncline

        public double getRampIncline()
        Gets the angle formed by the slope and the bottom face.

        The angle is positive and in [0, pi].

        Returns:
        the slope angle.

      • evaluateQuery

        protected double evaluateQuery(double x,
                               double y,
                               double z,
                               us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Point3DBasics closestPointToPack,
                               us.ihmc.euclid.tuple3D.interfaces.Vector3DBasics normalToPack)
        Internal generic method used for the public API of any Shape3d.
        Specified by:
        evaluateQuery in class Shape3D<Ramp3D>
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the query expressed in the local coordinates of this shape.
        y - the y-coordinate of the query expressed in the local coordinates of this shape.
        z - the z-coordinate of the query expressed in the local coordinates of this shape.
        closestPointToPack - closest point to the query expressed in the local coordinates of this shape. Modified. Can be null.
        normalToPack - normal of the shape surface at the closest point. Modified. Can be null.
        Returns:
        the distance from the query to the closest point on the shape surface. The returned value is expected to be negative when the query is inside the shape.

      • isInsideEpsilonShapeFrame

        protected boolean isInsideEpsilonShapeFrame(double x,
                                            double y,
                                            double z,
                                            double epsilon)
        Tests if the query is located inside this shape given the tolerance epsilon.

        • if epsilon > 0, the size of this shape is increased by shifting its surface/faces by a distance of epsilon toward the outside.
        • if epsilon > 0, the size of this shape is reduced by shifting its surface/faces by a distance of epsilon toward the inside.

        Specified by:
        isInsideEpsilonShapeFrame in class Shape3D<Ramp3D>
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the query expressed in the local coordinates of this shape.
        y - the y-coordinate of the query expressed in the local coordinates of this shape.
        z - the z-coordinate of the query expressed in the local coordinates of this shape.
        epsilon - the tolerance to use for this test.
        Returns:
        true if the query is considered to be inside this shape, false otherwise.

      • epsilonEquals

        public boolean epsilonEquals(Ramp3D other,
                             double epsilon)
        Tests separately and on a per component basis if the pose and the size of this ramp and other's pose and size are equal to an epsilon.
        Parameters:
        other - the other ramp which pose and size is to be compared against this ramp pose and size. Not modified.
        epsilon - tolerance to use when comparing each component.
        Returns:
        true if the two ramps are equal component-wise, false otherwise.

      • geometricallyEquals

        public boolean geometricallyEquals(Ramp3D other,
                                   double epsilon)
        Compares this and other to determine if the two ramps are geometrically similar, i.e. the difference between their size are less than or equal to epsilon and their poses are geometrically similar given epsilon.
        Parameters:
        other - the ramp to compare to. Not modified.
        epsilon - the tolerance of the comparison.
        Returns:
        true if the ramps represent the same geometry, false otherwise.
